content:
Se hai cambiato server ed hai usato Thunderbird nel periodo di transizione, può essere che Thunderbird ha trovato il server vuoto ed abbia cancellato tutto. Cosa implicita nel protocollo IMAP.

Comunque se li hai su Gmail non dovrebbe volerci molto a ri-sincronizzare tutto.

IMAP è un arma a doppio taglio, suggerisco sempre di fare una copia locale sotto Cartelle Locali.
creator: @next

creator: MARCOVISONA

content:
Here is the recovery for a forgotten primary password: Choose Tools -> Developer Tools > Error Console, paste the expression: 

  openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")     and press the Evaluate button. That will open a dialog asking you if you want to reset your password. If Evaluate is not seen, press enter key. When prompted, press the Reset button.

This removes all account passwords so they will need to be entered again.
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird keeps no backups. For the 30 day retention, check settings for the account at 'synchronization&storage', as that is the only place with that setting.
creator: davidsk

content: Try this: change server to outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS and authentication to OAUTH2.
creator: davidsk

content: My suggestion: when that happens select an available folder to allow finishing the filter. Then, click edit to make the correction.
